adjectives.description: claustrophobic (comparative more claustrophobic, superlative most claustrophobic)

entries.meaning: (psychology) Suffering from claustrophobia; being scared of being enclosed in a confined space.
examples: Using her hands like windshield wipers, she tried to flick snow away from her mouth. When she clawed at her chest and neck, the crumbs maddeningly slid back onto her face. She grew claustrophobic.

entries.meaning: Cramped and confined, so as to induce claustrophobia.
